review_blob: 33 cl bottle, sample. Pours golden amber, with a big eggshell head. Good lacing, medium carbonation. Fresh hops on the nose; orange citrus. Body is light to medium. Starts sweet, finishes bitter.

Bottle 33cl, sample. Pours pitch black, small brownish head. Soft carbonation. Getting roasty tones, dark chocolate, caramel/toffe, vanilla, licorice... rum! Body is medium to full, creamy texture. Starts sweet, finishes both bitter and sweet.
beer_name: Edge Brewing / Cigar City Gift To Gaspar - Barrel Aged

review_blob: On tap at the brewery. Pours slightly hazy, golden yellow. Quite big, white, creamy head. Fully lasting with good lacing, lively carbonation. Big hops on the nose - pine, grapefruit, melon. Pretty light and dry body, with a quite bitter kick.

On tap at the brewery. Pours golden yellow, slightly hazy. Decent white head, last a bit but not very long. Nose is typical hefe - yeasty, some banana, light malty/bready, and citrus. Body is light, pretty dry, bit thin. Carbonation is soft.
Nice and clear amber beer with egg shell type head. Aroma is very much cookie. Medium body with a somewhat watery finish.

Pours a clear golden/amber with a frothy white head that stays around with decent lacing. PIcking up some sweet citrus, like orange, on the nose. Slightly bready, with some spices, perhaps coriander? Not very fizzy, but still not flat. Body is medium and finishes dry. Flavor has some early light sweetness, some acidic, and finishes a bit more acidic or perhaps sour.
beer_name: Edge Brewing / Magic Rock Brewing Twisted Verbena

review_blob: Light colored, hay. Big white head, frothy and creamy. Good lacing. 18 month old batch! Light citrusy aroma, some typical saison funk bit not much. Body is light, taste of citrus, a bit acidic. Finishes quite dry in a really good way.

Half year old can. Pours hazy yellow gold, small but firm white head. Lemon all around. Light and crisp, bitter finish (for a pils). Easy drinking, but would have wished for more of a malt background.

Can, 3/24/2015, half year old. Pours hazy golden with a small off-white head. Decent carbonation despite almost no pressure in the can. Aroma is some resin, sweet malty. Body is thin, almost watery, nice balance, finishes bitter. Would want to try a fresh pour.
Can from 3/11/15. Pours hazy amber, off white head, sticks around. Sweet on the nose, caramel, resin, stine fruits? Medium to full body, quite sweet.

Can, unreadable date. Pours
sligthly hazy light coppar, quickly disapating white head. Pine and caramel aroma. Medium body, sweet start, bitter piney finish.

Can brewed on 3/18/15. Pours hazy coppar, decent off-white head. Tropical and stone fruit on the nose, some resin. Medium body, lots of tropical fruit with piney bitterness. Caramell sweetness to balance.
Can, BB aug/2016. Pours dark red amber, small off white head, nice lacing. Just a slight haze. Herbal and floral on the nose. Quite bitter throughout, with nice caramel/bready/malty to balance it.

Can. Pours golden coppar, small head. Little carbonation. Piney and resiney on the nose. More the same when you taste it. Light body, not much sweetness. A big hit of bitterness towards the end, pine and grapefruit. Lingers.

Can, probably 4-5 month old. Pours light brown/coppar, thick off-white to yellow head that is retained well. Aroma is dank, piney, resiney. First taste is caramel, syrup like. More of that musky, earthy kind of hops, then comes a piney bitterness towards the end. Medium body, nice lacing, lingering bitterness.

Bottle at tasting. First batch. Super clear, light amber. No head. Quite fizzy. Passionfruit aroma. Nice sour level, very drinkable. Sourness feels/taste like greek yoghurt. More passionfruit and tropical fruit. Slightly bready but also a bit watery. Great drinkability and lots of passionfruit.

Bottle. Pitch black, light brown head. Good retention. Smell is all about the Cs: Cinnamon, Clove, Cardemom, Chai, Coffe, Chocolate... Christmas! Very thick and creamy with low to medium carbonation. Nicely balanced with both bitter and sweet tones. Really enjoyed it, may have to get a few bottles to store until Christmas.
beer_name: Stone Imperial Russian Stout - Chai Spiced

review_blob: Dark brown, only a tad light slips through. Large, thick, latte head that stays around. Chocolate and vanilla dominates the nose. And the taste. Medium body. Some bitterness towards the end, but also lingering chocolate and vanilla.
beer_name: Edge Brewing Padrino Porter - Chocolate & Vanilla

review_blob: Golden honey color, off white head. Fruity aroma, first thought is hops, but might be esters. Slightly sweet, light/medium body, bitter finish. Bitterness overtakes, but some fruit and spicy combo before that.
Nice malty, herbal, dank, spicy nose. Deep amber color, latte head, nice lacing. Slightly hazy. Good balance, malty and more of that hop. Then the bitterness kicks in, strong, in the finish.

Bottle at room temp. Pitch black, latte head, dissapates. Decent lacing. Roasty, sligthly sour on the nose. Nice creamy body. Coffee, chocolate, roast, burnt, somewhat boozy but not overwhelming. Finish bitter, dry. Overall pretty round, nothing sharp sticks out. Very pleasant.
UPDATED: MAR 25, 2015
beer_name: Edge Brewing Eternal Sunshine Orange IPA

review_blob: Brnstensfrgad, off-white skum, lgger sig snabbt. Karamel, torkade frukter. Bra balans mellan malten och beskan. Viss beska mot slutet, men inte srskilt aggressiv.
50cl bottle shared. Black body, latte head, poor retention. Strong raspberry on the nose, hints of licorice. Sour raspberry taste, fades into roasty notes and a slight bitterness.
beer_name: Thornbridge / S:t Eriks Imperial Raspberry Stout

review_blob: Can. Light golden color with a small white head and little retention. Heavy resin, some tropical fruit, on the nose. Quite sweet upfront. Some bitterness shine through, then balances out nicely.
beer_name: Pizza Port Swamis India Pale Ale

review_blob: Slightly hazy wheat-colored with white head, small but nice retention. Hoppy on the nose, but not a bomb. Resin, citrus. Light body, nice bitterness, grapefruit. Some sweetness, enough to give some balance.
beer_name: Pizza Port Ponto Sessionable India Pale Ale

review_blob: Canned on sep/9th. Amber colored, no head to speak of. Spice, resin, sweet. Nice sweet malty taste, more resin. No real bitterness. Somewhat one-dimensional.
UPDATED: FEB 26, 2015

On tap at edge brewing. Dark brown colored with off-white/latte head. Nice retention. Nicely malty on the nose, like a burnt caramel, sligthy roasty. Balanced body, lingering bitterness. Roasted coffe, caramel, chocolate? Not getting a lot of hops, could be for this lingering cold, need to revisit at a later date.

Bottle from batch PON001.

Pours like a RIS should, more like syrup than beer. Nice looking head, between latte and mocka, but head retention is short. Smells lovely, a lot of roasted and burnt flavors, coffe, chocolate, bread. Once you have a mouthfull, theres more from where that came from, but also some vanilla and licorice. Sweet early that fades into a bitter finish. After a few mouths, the ABV is more apparent, but not in a bad way. Enjoyed it a lot. Wish I knew how long it has been aging, but with a best before judgement day its not easy to tell.

Dark brown color. Very strong smell, cloves, lovely wintery almost Christmas tones. Same nice flavors in the mouth, but it feels a bit flavoured. Not really cohesive, but not bad. Not very sweet at all. Some bitterness towards the end, probably from cloves. The color and aroma on the nose had me believing it would be a full body, but its quite light.
UPDATED: MAR 25, 2015

12oz bottle. Hazy, dark amber. Head is white towards latte, kinda small, but good retention. Nose is caramel, resin, spice. Nice balance on the palate. Getting some sweetness and spices, then it fades into a grapefruity bitterness.

12 oz Bottle, bought in Barcelona. Label says brewed in San Diego.

Pours really hazy. Surprised to see so many raters saying clear. Coppar/amber colored, with a white, not-too-large head. Nice head retention.

Getting a nice hit of fresh hop aromas. Floral, slight citrus, resin. Taste is nicely balanced, with bitterness coming through late and stays for quite some time. More of the same hops, as well as pine.

Bottle at Edge Brewing. NIce and clear, dark brown color. Intense sweet malty aromas with nuts, toffee and caramel. Medium to full body, not too heavily carbonated. Getting more of the toffee and caramel with some bread, also some spice. Feels dryer towards the finish, getting more of a roasted flavour. Bitterness creeps in and stays for quite awhile. Very enjoyable.
UPDATED: OCT 29, 2014

On tap at Edge Brewing. Coppery color with a very strong head. Very sharp, strong citrus armoa with some fruit notes. Nice mix of sweet and sour tones in the flavour, getting a lot of citrus and some toffee. I havent had many saisons before, but I will try it much more often after this one, really like it.

Tapped at Edge Brewing. Nice clear amberish color with a pretty nice persistent head. Really intense hops aroma, fresh and vibrant. Floral and citrus. Flavour balanced slightly to the bitter side. Not getting a lot of malty flavours, hops is overpowering; but I like it!
beer_name: Edge Brewing Flor de la Vida

review_blob: Bottle served at Edge Brewing. Nice golden color with a decent head that stays for quite awhile. Aroma isnt that intense, slighly sweet. Getting more flavour once I take a mouthful, some caramel and nicely balanced. Pretty light body with a lively carbonation. Some bitterness comes through the end. Overall a very drinkable beer.
Bottled, and probably quite old. Hazy amber color. Decent head, mediocre retetion. Some earthyness and caramel upfront. Quite bitter towards the end, stays for some time.

Bottled, and probably quite old. Hazy amber color. Decent head, mediocre retetion. Not getting a lot from this beer. Some small earthy tones, slight metallic after taste. Will question any recipe that calls for Willamette.

Bottled, and probably quite old. Hazy amber color. Decent head, mediocre retetion. This one is coming off very strong from the get go. Earthy, malty, bready. Distinct coconut, had not expected that! Sorachi is supposedly quite bitter, but Im not getting that. Not sure if the aromas overtake it or if tasting too many from this series at once has dulled the senses.
Bottled, and probably quite old. Hazy amber color. Decent head, mediocre retetion. Quite fruity with a clear bitterness through.
Bottled, and probably quite old. Hazy amber color. Decent head, mediocre retetion. Earthy, slightly sour aroma. Bitter towards the end with some metallic aftertones.
Bottled, and probably quite old. Hazy amber color. Decent head, mediocre retetion. Slightly earthy with some sweetness, like a fruit and caramel touch. Not too bitter, quite even throughout.
